edge: Kantara is a 2022 Indian Kannada-language action thriller film written and directed by Rishab Shetty, and produced by Vijay Kiragandur, under Hombale Films.
Rishab Shetty, in a dual role, is the Kambala champion who is at loggerheads with an upright forest officer named Murali (played by Kishore) in the film.
Murali is an upright forest officer who is at loggerheads with the Kambala champion (played by Rishab Shetty) in the film.
Principal photography for the film began in August 2021 at Keradi in coastal Karnataka.
The cinematography for the film was handled by Arvind S. Kashyap.
B. Ajaneesh Loknath scored music for the film.
The action sequences in the film were choreographed by action director Vikram More.
The production design for the film was handled by debutant, Dharani Gange Putra.
The film received critical acclaim from critics, particularly for its cast performances (particularly those of Shetty and Kishore), direction, soundtrack, and the portrayal of Bhuta Kola.
Kantara emerged as the second highest-grossing Kannada film of all time after K.G.F: Chapter 2, released the same year.
The film was a major commercial success.
It was also 2022's fourth highest-grossing film in India.
A prequel called Kantara: Chapter 1 has been announced.
Kantara was featured at the 54th IFFI Indian panorama section,
where it won the Silver Peacock - Special Jury Award.
during the promotion of his latest film as a producer, rishab shetty mentioned that the kannada version alone attracted an audience of 1.25 crore in karnataka
during his journey to discover true happiness, the king came upon a holy stone in a forest occupied by panjurli daiva.
panjurli warned the king that his family and successors should keep their word and not reclaim the land in exchange for taking the stone with him.
panjurli's companion, the ferocious demigod named guliga daiva, would incur the wrath if his warning is not followed by king's family and successors.
the descendant asked a bhoota kola performer, who is possessed by panjurli to make the locals hand over the land to him.

the performer refused to make the locals hand over the land to the descendant, warning that if the former goes to court for the decision of the land, then the daiva would give his decision on the stairs of the court only.
murali was tasked with dealing with forest issues in the area where the king's descendant attempted to reclaim the land, causing mysterious deaths.
the king's successor dies mysteriously of heart attack, where he was going to argue the land case.
tasked with converting the villagers' land into a forest reserve

After meeting what seems to be his father's spirit, Shiva disappears into the forest.

node_1: conflict between nature and human beings
edge: Director Rishab Shetty cited the conflict between nature and human beings as the theme of the film, while adding specifically that the strife between forest officers and the inhabitants in his hometown Keradi, Karnataka, in the 1990s, as the source of inspiration for the film.

The protagonist learned about the intricacies of Kambala and trained for four months before performing the sequence for the film.
The music of the film 'Kantara' was composed by B. Ajaneesh Loknath.
Besides B. Ajaneesh Loknath, around 30-40 musicians were brought in to work on the music for 'Kantara'.
The team was assisted by Mime Ramdas during the creation of songs using traditional instruments and Jaanapada songs in 'Kantara'.
The song 'Varaha Roopam' from the movie 'Kantara' was supposedly plagiarized from the song 'Navarasam' by the band Thaikkudam Bridge, who released it in 2017.

After a legal battle, the song 'Varaha Roopam' from the movie 'Kantara', which was modified with a new orchestral arrangement and vocals while the lyrics remained the same when it was released on Amazon Prime, finally returned to the movie after reaching a private settlement in the plagiarism case.
The makers announced that the film will be dubbed in Telugu language and was released on 15 October 2022.
The makers announced that the film will be dubbed in Hindi language and was released on 14 October 2022 in over 800 screens across the country.
The makers announced that the film will be dubbed in Tamil language and was released on 15 October 2022.
The makers announced that the film will be dubbed in Malayalam language and was released on 15 October 2022.
The Hindi version of the film was announced to be released in over 800 screens across the country, but later it was reported to be released in 2500 screens in the Hindi version.
The film was released on 15 October 2022 in both Telugu and Tamil languages.
The film was released on 15 October 2022 in both Telugu and Malayalam languages.
Following a social media campaign based on the film's connection to Tulu culture, a Tulu language dub of the Hindi version was announced.
The film was released on 15 October 2022 in both Telugu and Tamil languages outside of India, and the Tamil version was also released in India on 2 December.
The film became the first Kannada movie to be released in Vietnam.
The satellite rights of the film were acquired by Star India Network for all these languages.
The Hindi version was streamed on Netflix from 9 December 2022, and an English dubbed version of the film will be available for streaming in January 2023.
The film was digitally streamed on Amazon Prime Video from 24 November 2022 in all these languages.

node_2: neat blend of crime and divinity
edge: The critic A. Sharadhaa highlights the film's neat blend of crime and divinity, showcasing how these seemingly opposite elements come together in a cohesive narrative.

The cinematographer Arvind S Kashyap's meditative shots bring the native culture to life, showcasing its grandeur and capturing rustic locales with brilliance.

In response to the movie, the Government of Karnataka has initiated a monthly initiative

The Government of Karnataka's initiative to provide a monthly allowance for Buta Kola performers above 60 years of age, in response to the movie, highlights its positive impact on the community depicted in the film. This indicates a successful outcome for the movie.
